Class Screen

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Canvas
        • Screen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EndScreen, GamePanel, OpenWorldPanel, SplashScreen

    public abstract class Screen
extends java.awt.Canvas
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The Screen class aids in the processing and drawing of the game.

    Screen

    Date: 2016/05/26

    Version:
    1 2016/05/26
    Author:
    David White and Sepehr Hosseini
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • Screen

        public Screen(java.lang.String threadName)
        This creates a new instance of the Screen class with the specified thread name.

    • Method Detail

      • wait

        public void wait(int ticks)
        This programs halts processing for a specified number of ticks
        Parameters:
        ticks - the number of ticks that should be waited before resuming processing.

      • tick

        public abstract void tick()
        This method is intended to hold the processing of all implementing classes.

      • refresh

        public abstract void refresh(java.awt.Graphics g)
        This method is intended to hold the drawing of all implementing classes.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics object to be drawn on.

      • refresh

        public void refresh()
        This method refreshes the graphics of the Screen class.

        Local variables:

        bs This is used as reference to BufferStrategy.

        g Graphics object that is used as reference to Graphics.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when the program attempts to create a BufferStrategy before the screen is visible.

      • run

        public void run()
        This method handles the processing and drawing of the Screen class and ensures that processing only occus 60 times per second.

        Local variables:

        timeOld This holds the previous nanosecond value of the computer clock.

        timeNew This holds the current nanosecond value of the computer clock.

        frameRate This holds the value of how long each update shouls last.

        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • start

        public void start()
        This method starts the Screen.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        This method stops the Screen.
